arcade.env.comp

Class SourceSites

  • java.lang.Object
    • arcade.env.comp.Sites
      • arcade.env.comp.SourceSites
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Component, java.io.Serializable, sim.engine.Steppable

    public class SourceSites
extends Sites
    Extension of Sites for source sites.

    Each index in the lattice can be assigned as a site, depending on the initial spacings in the x direction (length, X_SPACING), y direction (width, Y_SPACING), and z direction (depth, Z_SPACING). Each spacing can be defined as:

    • * = all indices in the lattice
    • x or X = no indices in the lattice
    • *:INC = all indices in the lattice incremented by INC (i = 0, INC, 2*INC, ... , n*INC) where n*INC ≤ lattice size
    • INDEX = only index INDEX
    • MIN:MAX = all indices between MIN and MAX, inclusive
    • MIN:INC:MAX = all indices between MIN and MAX incremented by INC (i = MIN, MIN + INC, MIN + 2*INC, ... , MIN + n*INC) where MIN + n*INC ≤ MAX

    Setting all spacings to * creates a constant source. Setting any spacings to x removes all sites.

    The amount of concentration added to each index is the difference between the concentration at the index and the source concentration of the molecule. Sites can be damaged by setting the SOURCE_DAMAGE parameter, which reduces the amount of concentration added at each index.

    Since:
    2.3
    Version:
    2.3.15
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SourceSites

        public SourceSites(MiniBox component)
        Creates a Sites object with source sites.

        Specifications include:

        • X_SPACING = spacing of sites in x direction
        • Y_SPACING = spacing of sites in y direction
        • Z_SPACING = spacing of sites in z direction
        • SOURCE_DAMAGE = source site damage scaling
        Parameters:
        component - the parsed component attributes

    • Method Detail

      • checkSource

        private boolean checkSource(java.lang.String[] sites,
                            int v)
        Checks if a given index is a valid source site.
        Parameters:
        sites - the site spacing
        v - the index
        Returns:
        true if the index is valid, false otherwise

      • equip

        public void equip(MiniBox molecule,
                  double[][][] delta,
                  double[][][] current,
                  double[][][] previous)
        Equips a molecule to the sites.

        For each molecule, the following parameters are required:

        • CONCENTRATION = source concentration of molecule
        Specified by:
        equip in class Sites
        Parameters:
        molecule - the molecule parameters
        delta - the array holding changes in concentration
        current - the array holding current concentration values
        previous - the array holding previous concentration values

      • getDamage

        public double[][][] getDamage()
        Gets the damage array.
        Returns:
        the array of damage values

      • makeSites

        public void makeSites(Simulation sim)
        Creates sites.

        Iterates through each index in the lattice and assigns it as a site or not, depending on the specified spacings. Initial damage array is set to 1.0 (no damage).

        Specified by:
        makeSites in class Sites
        Parameters:
        sim - the simulation instance.

      • step

        public void step(sim.engine.SimState state)
        Steps through the lattice for each molecule to calculate generation.
        Parameters:
        state - the MASON simulation state

      • toJSON

        public java.lang.String toJSON()
        Represents object as a JSON entry.

        The JSON is formatted as: 

             {
         "type": "SITE",
         "class": "source",
         "specs" : {
             "SPEC_NAME": spec value,
             "SPEC_NAME": spec value,
             ...
         }
     }
        Returns:
        the JSON string

        Updates the component with old and new locations.
